itemDescription: Stanhope [née Forester], Anne Elizabeth, countess of Chesterfield (1802–1885), political confidante

wikipedia_page.main: Anne Elizabeth Stanhope, Countess of Chesterfield (née Weld-Forester; 7 September 1802 – 27 July 1885) was known as a political confidante.

response: On 4 March 1890, Lord Burghclere married Lady Winifred Anne Henrietta Christiana, daughter of Henry Herbert, 4th Earl of Carnarvon and Lady Evelyn Stanhope (a daughter of George Stanhope, 6th Earl of Chesterfield and Anne Stanhope, Countess of Chesterfield). Lady Winifred was the widow of Captain the Hon. Alfred John George Byng (a son of George Byng, 2nd Earl of Strafford), who died in 1887. Together, they were the parents of four daughters:Kidd, Charles, Williamson, David (editors). Debrett's Peerage and Baronetage (1990 edition). New York: St Martin's Press, 1990.
** 16 April – Anne Stanhope, Duchess of Somerset (born 1497)
